name: HTWC High Technology World Company
overview:
HTWC’s mission is the modernisation of enterprise legacy environments, breaking free from the legacy shackles, and shifting budget away from just achieving a status quo, over to creating dynamic enterprise IT solutions

HTWC aim to be the number 1 Mainframe Modernization specialist, thus an Inherent contributor to IT strategies globally

A large majority of the worldâ€™s IT enterprise applications are hosted upon IBM Mainframe systems. Viewed by many as the corner stone of their IT, Mainframes however present CIOs with a major conundrum. On one side, it is a vital cog in the IT engine room and is deemed irreplaceable, on the other, high costs and legacy obsolescence, are increasingly consuming IT resources, whilst raising barriers for forward looking innovations.

Modernization simply means, keeping the good and discarding the bad.

Market data indicates rapidly increasing awareness in the benefits of re-hosting Mainframe systems, with views to re-invest the ROI benefits into progressing enterprise applications and development environments. In this paper, High Technology World Company (HTWC) presents an opportunity for Microsoft to grow its market share for enterprise solutions, thus profiting upon first, and second ball revenue opportunities, whilst eroding a significant revenue source from one of its major competitors.
